title: Bus Application Analyst III
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

Business Application Ownership and Management at TD is part of an enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. We strive to be the better bank, and in this role, we’ll count on you to be our interface between business and technology.

We’re looking for highly analytical, collaborative and agile professionals who can merge and translate data to build business momentum and deliver results.

Using professional and experiential knowledge, the Business Application Ownership and Management team works in close partnership with corporate functions and technology, as well as aligns to project management, business analysis, business management, strategy and governance.

If you get business application management, its potential and power, we think you’ll love working with like-minded and innovative experts at TD, where you can help drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.

Job Description

About this Role

Are you a conceptual and analytical thinker, at ease working on your own or together with a team? In this professional role you will provide specialized business application management guidance and support for a designated functional area. You’ll be responsible for gathering requirements related with the application lifecycle, business testing and process documentation as well as end-user support of the business applications.

As a Business Application Analyst III, you will:

  • Bring advanced knowledge of applications management, supported by your team, including system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules
  • Provide functional business application management program support within an area of specialty
  • Elicit, analyze, document, communicate, and manage requirements/user stories with stakeholders and pod members by applying a variety of elicitation techniques to probe, challenge, and understand requirements according to the requirements management discipline and alignment to TD standards/processes, industry best practices and NEW Agile @ Scale framework
  • Identify, document, and validate current state processes and work with stakeholders to design the desire future state
  • Lead requirements management from high level, mid level to detailed level business requirements (including business use cases/scenarios, business rules, business process maps, customer data flows, themes/initiatives) and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications considering non-functional requirements and accessibility standards (i.e., epics, stories, tasks, etc.)
  • Support PO in the development of story map and creation of epics and spikes/enablers that require additional technical expertise
  • Lead and facilitate user story refinement ceremonies
  • Bridge the communication between PO and development/QE members, and lead the delivery of requirements/user stories across the pod
  • Active participation in all POD ceremonies including PI Planning, Sprint Planning, Daily Standups, End of Sprint Demo/showcases, and Retrospectives
  • Establish and maintain full requirements traceability (Feature > HLR > Epic > WFs > detailed level User Stories)
  • Collaborate with PO, DCX, risk and technology partners to refine, estimate, prioritize and break down user stories into consumable size (i.e., completed within one sprint)
  • Proactively identify, communicate, and track requirement risks, issues, assumptions, dependencies, constraints
  • Provide recommendation to support the development of system design, test plans, and necessary artifacts to ensure business needs are met
  • Adhere to Enterprise project governance controls to ensure projects meet all performance, quality and compliance standards and conforms to appropriate disciplines
  • Contribute to Quality Assurance activities by supporting the development of test scripts and testing of developed solutions, including communication of issues and resolution
  • Provide sound technical knowledge and foundational understanding of the various components of the applications, supported by the team in relation to system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows and business rules (ex. UI, native vs web based, API, mid-tier/backend)

Requirements

What can you bring to TD?

Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

  • Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
  • Three (3) or more years relevant business analysis experience
  • Expert knowledge of business-supported applications and PDLC/Agile methodology along with policies, procedures and practices, competitors, and market trends
  • Proficiency in using analytical software tools, MS Office, process modeling, data analysis methods and reporting techniques, and Atlassian (Confluence, Jira, and its installed add-ons)
  • Ardent to work multi-functionally and independently, communicate (both in speaking and writing), provide direction or assistance and build positive working relationships across teams and functions through strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Data Analyst, Alternate Solutions Group
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

CIBC ASG, the Alternate Solutions Group, comprises several direct, digital banking businesses, including Global Money Transfer and Simplii Financial – CIBC’s Canadian digital banking brand. It is an innovative and fast moving branch of the CIBC Capital Markets group.

The ASG Analytics team supports these businesses by producing data analysis and modelling to increase operational efficiency, improve client experience and drive revenue.

You will work closely with our business and technology partners in ASG to understand the business initiatives and produce end-to-end analytics solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

Expertise: You will utilize your knowledge of machine learning and finance to frame and solve business problems using predictive and prescriptive analytics. You will draw on familiarity of multiple ML domains such as classification, regression, time-series forecasting, recommender systems, reinforcement learning and causal inference. You will grow in the role, keeping up to date with developments in the field of finance and machine learning. You will build analytics products by writing code that is reliable, reproduceable and maintainable

Communication: You will engage with business partners and asking the right questions to understand their challenges. You’ll be able to formulate and communicate solutions in an accessible way, and answer questions and concerns brought up by our partners.

Partnership: You will collaborate with the other members of the analytics team and bring your own perspectives to their problems and be open to suggestions on the best approaches for your own work. Together we will drive the success of the team.

Who You Are

You have deep quantitative knowledge, preferably with a graduate degree in computer science, engineering, statistics or other scientific or mathematical discipline, or equivalent experience.

You have 3 years work experience in analytical roles, including experience with data wrangling and programming skills to access, transform and prepare large datasets.

You also have a forward-looking, results-oriented approach to building out insights from data and analytics, and a history and track record of end-to-end responsibility for growing businesses with those insights.

You have extensive knowledge of:

  • Writing complex queries in SQL and working with data warehouses

  • Python programming

  • Software development tools, IDEs and Git for version control

  • Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI

Also beneficial:

  • Understanding of Docker and Kubernetes

  • Exposure to big data frameworks (PySpark, SparkML)

  • Machine learning libraries (pandas, scikit-learn, xgboost)

  • ML/AI Frameworks (Pytorch or Tensorflow)

  • Exposure to financial data, especially foreign exchange data

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive compensation, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

Job Location

Toronto-161 Bay St., 4th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision (Remote)
description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision to join our growing ML team. You will work on challenging computer vision problems to have an impact on the 31,000+ life scientists across the world who rely on BenchSci for their research. Reporting to the Engineering Manager, ML, you'll apply your domain expertise to select, train and deploy the best-suited machine learning algorithms, collaborate and experiment with scientists, and apply techniques to build solutions to shape the future of scientific discovery. You will have plenty of room for technical innovation and greenfield to explore and propose computer vision solutions to a complex area.

You will:

    • Improve the performance and scalability of ML models and pipelines that are at the core of BenchSci's products
    • Work on different stages of the problem from prototyping to production
    • Contribute to key components across the machine learning ecosystem defining BenchSci's ML Technical Roadmap
    • Investigate what technologies that will best enable BenchSci to identify experimental insights through proof-of-concepts
    • Work with diverse teams to correctly capture the nuances of biology, translating them into ML objectives
    • Advocate for code and engineering process improvements across your team, and help define best practices
    • Participate in sprint planning, estimations, and reviews
    • Work with teammates to ensure high-quality deliverables

You have:

    • 3+ years of experience working as a professional developer, with at least 2 years of this focused on machine learning and computer vision
    • A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other related disciplines
    • Excellent software engineering skills in Python
    • Comprehensive knowledge in the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, including the nuances of the infrastructure and operationsExperience with ML and/or Computer Vision fundamentals
    • Experience productionizing ML models Experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, and image processing libraries such as OpenCV and Scikit-image
    • Experience with distributed and cloud-based data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark or Apache Beam
    • A constant desire to develop
    • A team player who strives to see teammates succeed together


Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
15 days vacation plus an additional day every year; plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year
Unlimited flex time for sick days, personal days, religious holidays
Comprehensive health and dental benefits Emphasis on mental health with $2500 CAD* for Psychologist, Social Worker, or Psychotherapist services
A $2000 CAD* Annual Learning & Development budget
A $1000 CAD* home office set-up budget
A $2500 CAD*wellness, lifestyle and productivity spending account for employees
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options
*Benefits are tied to Canadian dollar amounts and would be converted to local currency for those in other countries. Moving to local currency allotments in the future.

About BenchSci:
BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.
Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

Our Culture:
BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.
We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.
You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.

Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

#LI-Remote

title: Engineering Manager, Machine Learning - Natural Language Processing (Remote)
description:
We are looking for an Engineering Manager, Natural Language Processing to join our growing Machine Learning team and will report to the Director of Engineering, Machine Learning. You will lead a team that works on challenging problems to have an impact on the 41,000+ scientists across the world who rely on BenchSci for their research. As an Engineering Manager, NLP and Deep Learning, you will manage planning and prioritization of upcoming work, coordinate multiple engineering teams, and coach team members. You will work closely with tech leads and scientists to evaluate priorities, spot potential problems before they occur, and support the team's technical roadmap with planned engineering investments. Our ideal candidate is flexible, supportive and knows when to step in and work hands-on with their team and when to lean out and direct.

You will:

    • Execution: Own and drive execution of product and technical roadmaps. You will maintain and oversee the quality and output for everything your team provides
    • Management: Take a leadership role in our hiring and onboarding processes. You will mentor your team, guide their growth, and manage performance with fair, inclusive, and equitable practices
    • Technical: Work with technical leads and engineers to provide guidance on technical solutions, backup plans, trade-offs, and design. You will ensure your experienced team provides quality, ensuring they feel a culture of risk-taking, and can experiment to find the best solutions. You will work hands on when needed to support your team's delivery goals.
    • Processes: Work with Science, Web Apps, and Data Teams to define and improve processes across the company with growth in mind

You have:

    • 4+ years working as a professional developer
    • 2+ years working as an engineering team manager
    • Experience hiring and building motivated engineering teams
    • Strong experience with Python and programming fundamentals
    • Extensive experience working with NLP (including NER) and PyTorch
    • Experience with data engineering and machine learning design patterns and best practices
    • Experience shipping machine learning into distributed, data-intensive production systems
    • Strong experience collaborating cross-functionally
    • Worked on projects that have gone from proof-of-concept through multiple maintenance stages


Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
15 days vacation plus an additional day every year; plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year

Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options

We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.

title: Manager, Data Governance
description:
Requisition ID: 180410

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Scotiabank is currently seeking a Manager, Data Governance to join our growing team! This role contributes to the overall success of the GBM Data Office ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. This role would also ensure all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

Is this role right for you? You will be responsible for:

  • Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.
  • Ensures business stakeholder understanding, alignment and commitment to the objectives of the data governance and management program.
  • Understands business requirements and aligns them to the objectives of the data management program.
  • Design and document business requirements and functional requirements to support data-related initiatives for consumer data domains, including Finance, Credit Risk, Market Risk, Liquidity Risk, and other corporate functions (e.g., Compliance and Anti-Money Laundering) and their associated business areas/processes.
  • Conduct root cause analysis of data quality issues raised through automated validation rules and self-identified issues raised by data stewards, data consumers, and data producers.
  • Support data stewards in managing data governance and data management practices within their data domains and facilitate cross-domain initiatives and activities, as necessary.
  • Monitor data quality dashboards and exception reports, performing analysis to identify trends in data quality issues, perform root-cause analysis, establish data quality themes, and determine course(s) of action, creating action plans to resolve open items.
  • Supports business and regulatory initiatives driven by the Bank’s data management framework.
  • Assist with Data Office Annual Attestations and training requirements.
  • Prepare presentation materials for Risk working groups and committee meetings
  • Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
  • Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct, and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.

Do you have the skills you need to succeed? We'd love to work with you, if you have:

  • Bachelor's degree
  • Global Banking and Markets experience or Capital Markets experience an asset
  • Demonstrate curiosity and problem-solving abilities
  • Solid Data analysis ability to explore data and aware of current data analytics trends and technology
  • Excellent team player, working with cross-departmental business & IT stakeholders
  • Project management experience, able to drive initiatives from planning through to execution
  • Knowledge of regulatory/liquidity reporting and business processes (e.g., FR 2052A, Liquidity Stress Test, Reg YY, etc.) an asset
  • Knowledge of requirements gathering, design methodology, and building test cases - detail oriented, analytical, and capable of investigating complex / technical issue
  • Experience in Regulations and Matters Requiring Attention an asset

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Sr Business Insights Analyst
description:
Hours

37.5

Pay Details

We’re committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

Department Overview

The Business Banking Data & Analytics (BB D&A) group is responsible for stewardship of all analytics, reporting and data management requirements for Business Banking.

The group supports Business Banking product and sales teams in the areas of analytics, insights, performance measurement, business intelligence and reporting.

The group also develops and executes policies, practices and procedures that properly manage the business’s data needs and adhere to data governance standards as set out by the Enterprise Data Governance Office (EDGO) and Enterprise Data & Analytics (ED&A).

Job Details

About this Role

Reporting to the Manager (Data in Projects), the Senior Business Insights Analyst is responsible for the holistic identification of Business Analytics, Reporting and Data Management Requirements as part of several BB pods in Programs / Projects / BAU. They will work closely and take guidance from Business Bankers, Data Management Leads, and TS counterparts, while facilitating stakeholders in understanding the impact of business processes on the data, both net-new and existing.
The incumbent will also work together with project stakeholders to help drive several data activities, as defined by the BB Data in Projects Framework, including both the Enterprise Data Governance Office (EDGO) and Analytics capabilities as defined by Enterprise Data & Analytics (ED&A). The Senior Business Insights Analyst will help enable comprehensive analytics delivery within the project/pod, in a risk-managed approach aligned to the BB Data Strategy.

Accountabilities Include:

  • Responsible for 2-way scoping of Business Analytics, Reporting and Data Management Requirements for several BB projects / programs and Pods.
  • Facilitate a breakdown of business analytics requirements including to identify reporting needs both for implementation in both operational data stores as well as analytical platforms (i.e. Akora)
  • Collaborate across BB D&A Pillars to ensure appropriate development, business acceptance testing, rollout and transition to Day 2
  • Understand data structures being modified and created across the projects and conduct lineage / reverse-engineering to understanding impacts to existing BB D&A Artefacts (i.e. Reporting, Analytics)
  • Collaborate with project team to verify business data test cases scenarios covers data quality meeting data requirements; create new test cases if required. High level verification of the quality data in lower environments.
  • Ensure decisions and solutions are aligned with the BB Data in Projects Framework and the larger BB Data Strategy
  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation both across the entire data architecture, as well as within the project and the overall DIP Team
  • Conduct knowledge transfer with the project teams and with D&A Teams
  • Support the project team in quantifying the benefits to the Business bank through leveraging data
  • Facilitate and document current data state and future data target states to ensure effects of data are understood and communicated across all project stakeholders
  • Work effectively with multiple teams across a broad spectrum of initiatives and functional domains, influencing and aligning others as needed;
  • Provide functional / business level communications to ensure messages to stakeholders and / or employees are consistent, appropriate and aligned to business strategies and executive management direction;
  • Develop new standards for Data documentation for use by projects, and communicate these to both D&A, Business and Technology Stakeholders
  • Participate fully as a member of the Business Bank’s Data & Analytics team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues;
  • Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment that supports a diverse workforce

Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD?
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:

  • Seasoned Business Analyst leader with proven ability to assess, facilitate and ensure deliver holistic analytics, reporting and data management activities, on time and on budget, aligned to business needs
  • Experience leading data related initiatives with specific emphasis on data retention and disposition expertise considered an asset;
  • Strategic mindset with the ability to understand implications of key decisions on policies, down-stream processes, etc.;
  • Knowledge of Business Bank data and systems considered an asset;
  • Knowledge of platform and data warehouse design and principles is considered an asset
  • Knowledge and experience in Agile projects, Jira and confluence tools is considered an asset
  • Knowledge of Cloudera Hadoop, MS Azure, SAS and OCDO Data Management Capabilities are considered an asset
  • Experience in working on data integration projects or large scale, complex technology projects using formal project delivery methodology;
  • Hands-on experience working with SQL language to carry-on daily data profiling and data quality is considered an asset
  • Hand-on experience working with Microsoft tools like MS Visio and MS PowerPoint
  • Excellent relationship management skills;
  • Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills;
  • Strong organizational awareness;
  • Strong attention to detail and well-organized to manage large amounts of information and details
  • Superior negotiation and creative problem-solving skills

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid

Company Overview

Our Values
At TD we're guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes … because when colleagues feel their best, they're more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Inclusiveness

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We're Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Director, Enterprise Model Risk Management (EMRM) in our Group Risk Management (GRM) team, you will lead and execute the validation of the Bank’s enterprise-wide credit risk rating systems and methodologies, with focus on Wholesale credit risk systems including validation of Wholesale criteria paper models and replication to ensure integrity of ratings used for Basel compliance, capital accuracy, risk management, credit provisioning, and stress testing processes. You will develop and implement tools and methodologies required to underpin credit risk systems validation, and provide insightful robust analyses of credit risk systems validation.

What will you do?

  • Ensure efficient coordination and execution of Wholesale credit risk systems model validation processes and provide insightful and robust analyses of validation results
  • Ensure execution and documentation of appropriate qualitative and quantitative tests relating to Wholesale criteria papers, including review of logic and conceptual soundness of Wholesale criteria paper models and their inputs, accuracy, sensitivity, backtesting, benchmarking and analysis of the use of the criteria paper models
  • Develop and enhance approaches tailored to timelines and data availability, utilizing detailed or 80/20 solutions, and quantitative and/or qualitative approaches, as appropriate
  • Deliver validation findings and elicit feedback and remediation action plans / solutions from model stakeholders
  • Ensure project and risk objectives are accomplished within approved timeframes and complied with regulatory requirements, model risk policy and model operating standards
  • Perform a wide range of data reconciliations and analyses, e.g. organizing, interpreting and analyzing data using various statistical techniques catered for validation purposes
  • Lead a high performing team and provide focus and clarity in establishing individual goals, driving performance management, supporting career development and rewarding strong performance
  • Complete ad hoc analytical or empirical projects

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 7+ years of analytical and quantitative experience with a financial institution, in a related role such as a risk manager, a model developer/validator or data miner/analyst
  • Strong familiarity with design, development, and/or application of credit risk rating methodologies
  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science/information system, statistics, econometrics and/or a relevant professional qualification
  • Understand various data systems (e.g. Newton/CNB Newton, CCMS, CMS, Probe, Axiom, EBR, ESN, WCRD etc.) structures/processes and how they affect inputs and outputs of credit risk modelling/validation data
  • Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, detailed oriented and problem solving skills
  • Strong computer skills (SQL, Python and Microsoft Office Suite required; SAS strongly preferred)
  • Execute with urgency while maintaining quality and efficiency
  • Adapt to shifting priorities, coupled with a sense of urgency

Nice-to-Have

  • CFA, CPA, or FRM designations
  • Ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Exposure to credit risk system design and Basel parameter estimation is an asset
  • Ability to work in Unix, Teradata Data Warehouse and/or Data Lake environments
  • Ability to work with numerous data and IT infrastructures
  • Proactive learning and working skills

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Directs and coordinates risk management projects such as regulatory reviews, inspections, audits, etc. within the department. Manages activities through senior managers and managers and implements corporate and divisional strategic plans and budgets.

title: Manager, Business Analyst, Models - Retail and Small Business
description:
Requisition ID: 182871

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Overview

The world is changing faster than ever and so are we!

“Big data” fed by “complex processes” representing “massive stakes” are not just buzzwords to us; they are a genuine reflection of our daily life. Our goal is to be nothing less than The Leading Bank in The Americas that puts Customers First. Achieving this will require us to assemble and retain a Winning Team that can both design and run highly-predictive decisioning and forecasting models that accurately reflect reality. To put things in perspective, our models underpin automated risk-management decisions and forecasts that impact millions of customers and keep hundreds of billions of dollars safe, every single day. We are fortunate to have a world-class team of Data Scientists and Model Operations personnel building and deploying incredible risk models. But they need your help.

Our Regulatory Capital Model Development team is responsible for ensuring that every part of the model lifecycle, from planning to data selection, development to implementation, deployment to monitoring undergoes rigorous analysis and as well documented, controlled, effective and efficient, as possible. Getting models to market quickly is important but getting them “right” is even more so. That is where you come in:

You are capable of poking around “under the hood”, asking questions ad-nauseam (in a polite and collaborative way), mapping real world processes to technical logic, data flows and sources and accurately spec’ing out how our modeling and technology teams should use what you discovered.

We are results driven, we work hard, we play hard, we nerd out and we bring service, smiles and solutions to every problem that we face; so should you.

What Are We Looking For?

We want talented, pragmatic, analytically-oriented business analysts who are equally at home mapping and translating operational and technical processes into business rules and data flows, and working collaboratively with a diverse range of stakeholders to develop scalable solutions in the interest of improving our automated forecasting models and capital allocation.

We want bright and energetic but disciplined minds who come armed with a bottomless sense of curiosity about everything, a passion for getting things done right the first time, the ability to prioritize, a knack for explaining complex issues in simple concise ways and a deep sense of personal and professional accountability.

The ideal candidate will be a consummate team player who is equally comfortable being a:

  • Business Analyst / Business Consultant / Financial Analyst
  • Data Analyst
  • Software Architect
  • Process Engineer

Make an Impact

As Canada’s only truly global bank, we offer the opportunity to work in markets and with teams you may not otherwise get exposure to. You will be a critical member of a team collaborating, on a near daily basis, with a wide range of cross-bank stakeholders and internal partners including Data Scientists, Project Management Office, Technology & Data teams, Finance, Model Operations, and internal challenge functions.

You will work, day-to-day under the direction of the Regulatory Capital team, leveraging your analytic thinking and approach to support Regulatory Capital Modeling initiatives:

  • Plan and manage initiatives,
  • Map and / or re-engineer key processes, data flows and / or business rules
  • Translate concepts into algorithms and architect implementation solutions in accordance with business needs, and internal / regulatory policies and guidelines.

Potential deliverables / outcomes may include (but not be limited to):

  • Business, implementation and project plans that get executed to completion
  • Business rules, financial formulae and algorithms
  • Newly generated and retrofitted automated reporting
  • Improved operational efficiency and effectiveness
  • Quantitative analysis to support ongoing decision-making
  • Recommendations of what else “we should look into / fix” next

Is This Role Right for You?

  • You believe, first and foremost, in always doing the right thing and doing things the right way
  • You are both deeply curious and highly pragmatic
  • You are comfortable with data, analytic / technical and business processes
  • You relish ambitious but realistic goals and are committed to achieving them
  • You are comfortable initiating conversations and collaborating with diverse personalities
  • You are social, engaging, not afraid to ask questions and relish the opportunity to both learn and challenge how things are done in a polite and respectful way
  • You can prioritize activities to deliver the right balance of “quick wins” & lasting solutions
  • You understand and embrace the responsibility and weight that comes with the fact that your work will impact numerous high-level stakeholders
  • You look forward to sharing your ideas and insights through both high-quality effective and concise verbal & written communications
  • You are professional, motivated AND FUN. We mean it.

What Do You Need to Succeed?

General

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Information Sciences, Business / Commerce, Finance, or equivalent field
  • A demonstrated history of problem solving, technology implementation and sound judgement
  • Fluent English-language verbal and written communications: the ability to distill complex and ambiguous operational processes, business requirements / rules and data sets into process flows and analysis, concisely convey technical requirements and requests, prepare and edit high-quality documentation, and be accepted as a trusted advisor by peers
  • Experience as a Management Consultant, Business Analyst, Process Engineer, Financial Analyst or Data Analyst with a track record of accomplishments working on cross-functional teams
  • Able to work remotely and on-site on multiple activities simultaneously and meet deadlines

Technical

  • Strong fundamental understanding of business analysis, requirements definition, process mapping, data mapping and financial analysis
  • 3-5 years of overall experience in consulting, business analysis or process engineering roles translating complex human processes to mathematical algorithms
  • Highly proficient with business productivity (ex., Visio, MS Project, JIRA, Teams, Lists), data governance / lineage (ex. Informatica, Collibra) and data management (SQL, Excel, PowerBI) tools
  • Refined ability to translate data extraction, transformation and analysis into queries / code (SQL)

Nice to Have’s

General

  • Proficient reading, writing and speaking Spanish
  • Domain expertise with retail & small business banking products and / or risk management practices
  • Familiarity with credit risk models / scorecards
  • Lean, Six Sigma, TQM or other process management frameworks and/or expertise

Technical

  • An understanding of statistical prediction, estimation and forecasting models
  • Programming experience (Python, SAS) with both legacy / traditional (RDBMS) and big data (Hadoop / Hive / Spark) systems
  • An appreciation for advanced statistical approaches used to assess and address uncertainty

What’s in It for You?

  • We have an inclusive and collaborative work environment that values curiosity & ownership, encourages pragmatic creativity (i.e., true innovation), and celebrates success!
  • You'll get to work with and learn from an incredibly friendly and diverse group of accomplished leaders

You’ll have fun. We do.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

The Manager of QAS team in Corporate Treasury will be responsible for developing, enhancing, implementing and maintaining quantitative models and analytics suites using conventional econometric and machine learning techniques for the purposes of asset liability and interest rate risk management, customer analytics and profitability, and stress testing under various macro-economic scenarios. title: Product Owner, Data Enablement
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

This is an 18-month contract position.

We are looking for a bright, energetic, and ambitious individual to join our Data Engineering Team.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work with amazing teams and help them achieve their vision to deliver actionable information from data to enable business outcomes.

You will work with business stakeholders, IT, data science, and data engineering teams to develop a vision of what they want to achieve and the strategy and plans to get there, while at the same time working with cutting edge data technologies.

Your experience as a Product Owner means translating and prioritizing business needs to user stories and roadmaps. Your ultimate job is to ensure value comes out of your data product. You will take responsibility for the business success in terms of their dealings with your data product(s).

You are a passionate advocate for your stakeholders and will drive the deliverables to completion. Once completed, you will be responsible for data governance practices within your products, including metadata documentation and data quality, as well as facilitating resolution of those data issues. Your balance between technical and business knowledge and soft skills will be Key.

What will you do?

  • Develop a deep understanding of stakeholders’ business needs and outcomes
  • Work in collaboration with Business, IT, Data Engineering, and Data Science teams to design and deliver products that provide business value and drive downstream efficiencies
  • Gather requirements and document them as user stories, epics, and themes
  • Maintain a prioritized backlog
  • Provide ongoing support to stakeholders and users of the data products
  • Accountable for end-to-end delivery of the product, in partnership with IT
  • Work in collaboration with the Director to develop and execute on long term roadmaps
  • Monitor ongoing use of the data products to help direct future investment decisions
  • Maintain metadata and data dictionaries
  • Resolve conflicts and find compromises
  • Ensure data quality and facilitate issue resolutions
  • Assist in developing business case justification for product development, creating budget requests and managing funding allocations for the data product(s)
  • Partner with ES and Architecture to evaluate solution and design options
  • Acts as the go-to Subject Matter Expert for the data product(s), partnering with other SMEs in the business stakeholders, IT and Data Engineering teams to ensure coverage of expertise across the domain(s).

What do you need to succeed?

  • Proven experience with product leadership, ownership, and development in data and technology; including planning, execution and coordination of delivery activities across multiple teams and stakeholders
  • 3+ years as a Product Owner in Agile environment
  • Self-started with Owners Mindset
  • Excellent communication and influence skills while working with diverse stakeholders; ability to interact with multiple levels of management across business, IT, and Data Engineering
  • Ability to translate business needs and processes to requirements and technology direction
  • Demonstrated ability to assess business needs and conceptualize a vision for the product with the added ability to develop a product strategy and roadmap. Ability to communicate a shared vision and establish buy-in.
  • Experience with preparing cost estimates, presenting budget requests and managing to a budget.
  • Outstanding problem-solving skills and ability to facilitate problem identification, resolution and escalation across multiple business and technology disciplines.
  • High business acumen

What will be nice to have?

  • BS in Computer Science, Computer Programming, Informatics or equivalent
  • Insurance and/or Wealth Data Domain Product Experience
  • Knowledge of AWS and Database technologies
  • Familiarity with Data Science, including modeling
  • Familiarity with Data Engineering concepts such as ETL
  • Data Storyteller
  • Experience with managing multi-year roadmaps and business cases
  • Agile certification

What’s in it for you?

  • Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US - 2022
  • Great Place to Work® award for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork
  • 2022 Named “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor - 2021
  • Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work
  • 2021 Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer.

#LI-Hybrid #LI-remote

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Manager, Analytics
description:
Requisition ID: 191679

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose of Job:

The Manager contributes to the management of credit risk for the Retail portfolios by overseeing the data management and reporting function efforts with a specific focus on regulatory reporting. The Manager is responsible for the development, data analytics, data management and execution of analytical and trend-based risk management, executive management, and external stakeholder reporting packages and analytic requirements across the retail life cycle (origination, portfolio management, and collection). The Manager is responsible, but not limited to, for the timely delivery of a suite of existing regulatory reports and the development of new insightful analytics and reports as required.

Job Responsibilities:

The Manager, Analytics is responsible for driving the key deliverables for Retail Credit Risk Financial Reporting as related to monthly / quarterly reporting. Responsibilities include:

  • Ensure the design, development, maintenance and production of detailed reporting packages and data analytics for regulators, senior management and other external stakeholders, and the robust data management for Retail Credit Risk reporting and analytics by:

    • Designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining regulatory reports in SAS, HADOOP, GCP, Hive/Hue, SQL Server, Excel, and Power BI according to business or regulatory requirements.

    • Developing new reports and on-going enhancements.

    • Determining the best data compilation methods.

    • Developing and establishing new data sources.

    • Leading documentation and governance efforts of data, processes, reports.

    • Validating, testing, and reconciling reports with various information sources.

  • Support the standard and integrated EDL risk information system. Conduct business analysis of multiple sources for Canadian and International retail data. Develop and implement new data and reporting requirements as per the Retail Credit Risk Roadmap (HADOOP, Hue, SmartView, Power BI, SAS).

  • Maintain technical and business documentation to comply with Regulatory, Governance and Audit requirements.

  • Collect and author business and technical requirements/specifications. Ensure all processes are documented and appropriate controls are in place to satisfy audit/compliance requirements.

  • Work with technology teams to identify issues and implement solutions. Respond promptly to ad hoc requests/queries.

Job Requirements:

A minimum of five years of progressive, relevant and practical experience with leading financial organizations, preferably in the risk management, finance, marketing or IT fields, and a proven track record of success in the implementation/management of effective information systems.

  • Experience in developing and building reporting dashboards using Power BI.

  • Working knowledge of Business Intelligence and process automation software packages.

  • Data Warehousing knowledge & experience, including the management of multiple data sources.

  • Experience with manipulating large and complex datasets.

  • Design, development and implementation of decision support data management\analysis applications.

  • Maintaining a broad knowledge of current technology and practices; must have experience with the following:

    • SQL, SAS, Cognos, Business Objects.

    • Hadoop technology / tools (incl HIVE/HUE, Power BI).

    • Google Cloud Platform and related technologies.

    • Data Management, Database Design including data modeling and Data Warehousing skills.

  • Strong analytical and data mining skills with experience in manipulating large and complex datasets.


Knowledge and experience in the following areas are essential:

  • Knowledge of retail credit products, policies, portfolios and delivery systems.

  • Ability to work under pressure and deliver under tight deadlines

  • Substantial risk reporting experience will be required together with an understanding of risk data and statistics.

  • A strong knowledge of the Bank’s technical platform applications.

  • Industry knowledge of trends and best practices.

  • Must be accurate and thorough; effective time and project management; strong team work and communication skills

title: Manager, Data Engineering
description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Canadian Banking Operations (CBO) Data and Analytics Center of Excellence (COE) is hiring a Manager, Data and Analytics COE that will lead the enhancement of our data foundation through the engineering of critical data pipelines supporting strategic insights for CBO using cutting edge data capabilities.

What will you do?

  • Develop and maintain the automated data pipelines and infrastructure necessary to enabling the measurement of operations performance through single-source-of-truth datasets.
  • Partner with business intelligence and workforce analytics teams to accelerate speed to strategic decision-making with quicker insight delivery through data engineering and support.
  • Collaborate with business partners to understand and develop requirements for the ingestion and transformation of source-system data into meaningful and relatable performance datasets.
  • Ensure sound governance and controls are in place for all data pipelines including adherence to documentation standards.

What will you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Demonstrated capability of leveraging SQL and Python to solve data problems
  • Knowledge of and experience in design, development, and implementation utilizing big data technologies - Hadoop, Spark, Datameer, Teradata, SQL databases
  • Ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Comfort dealing with ambiguity and working independently.
  • Strong expertise in data engineering principles, practices, and tools including data modeling, ETL processes, data integration, and data warehousing
  • Solid experience in software development lifecycle and working knowledge of DevOps pipelines (GitHub, Jenkins, UCD/Helios)
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala, and experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms.

Nice-to-have

  • BSc. or Masters in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or Computer Science is preferred
  • Experience automating routine reporting work
  • Experience within Canadian Banking Operations

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Work in a safe, secure and positive work environment
  • Work with a dynamic team focused on innovation and collaboration

Actuarial Modeling, Big Data, Big Data Technologies, Business Acumen, Computer Science, Data Analysis, Data Engineering, Data Management, Data Mining, Data Pipelines, Data Science, Datasets, Decision Making, DevOps, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Predictive Analytics, Problem Solving, Python (Programming Language), Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Structured Query Language (SQL), Teamwork

title: Manager, Digital Analytics - CID&A
description:
Requisition ID: 193403

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Join the fast based team environment at Scotiabank as a Manager, Digital Analytics. The incumbent is a tagging, data analytics and insight specialist supporting digital marketing and banking initiatives across multiple channels and platforms to help drive engagement, leads, sales and loyalty. The successful candidate will create and tell comprehensive stories about how users behave using data. You’ll deliver analytics projects of moderate complexity, partnering with other analysts and cross-functional teams along the way. Through ongoing analysis, you will gain actionable insights that better address the business goals of our internal stakeholders. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate with analytics, marketing and digital banking squads to help optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of digital marketing campaigns, digital banking experience, and product strategy.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Develop Looker Studio dashboard in scrum setting to iteratively translate business requirement in visualization and insights
  • Work with senior stakeholder to perform on-demand product/digital analytics request
  • Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, analysis, and algorithms used and developed
  • Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real world data-driven changes
  • Analyze and interpret clickstream data, providing insights to inform digital banking experience optimization and campaign strategies.
  • Work with technical analytics resources to ensure tracking code is consistently applied and managed
  • Be flexible and thrive in an evolving environment
  • Adapt to change quickly and adjust work accordingly in a positive manner
  • Proactively initiate, research, and perform data analysis
  • Provide ad hoc reports to internal stakeholders on web usage, user engagement, and behavioral analytics on websites and email campaigns
  • Identify patterns and trends in marketing results and online activity and report on findings
  • Analyze digital marketing data and user behavior patterns to provide valuable insight and to optimize user engagement
  • Monitor site and campaign traffic and determine cross-promotion, cross-sell and lead-gen opportunities
  • Assist in the development and documentation of best practices for improving operational efficiencies within the digital analytics team
  • Familiarity with tag audit tools like ObservePoint and Tag Inspector
  • Identify bugs and erroneous analytics tags and provide solutions to development team
  • Work with Digital Channels to advise on our continually evolving digital strategy
  • Ability to provide clear and concise technical direction, expertise, advice and tracking solutions to frontend developers, backend developers, and analytic teams to build tools for measurement of client platforms

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We’d love to work with you if you have experience with:

  • 3+ years of proven working experience as a Digital Analyst, Digital Marketing Analyst, or similar role
  • 3+ years of experience with data segmentation and reporting within Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics
  • Experience with Google Tag Manager including setting up and configuring accounts for new websites and goals
  • Working knowledge of GA4
  • Proficient in building dashboards leveraging and blending data from multiple data sources, as well as extracting data from data environments such as BigQuery
  • 2+ years of working experience with SQL and relational databases technologies/concepts for both
  • Experience with Looker Studio and/or Power BI
  • Expertise in Google Analytics implementation using Google Tag Manager
  • 2+ years of experience programming in Python or Spark
  • 2+ years of experience with statistical analysis, machine learning and digital analytics (e.g., hypothesis driven analysis, and fraud/anomaly detection)
  • Experience working with digital advertising platforms and search engine optimization is an asset
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously
  • Proven ability to work independently and with other groups in a professional and productive manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work within tight deadlines
  • Excellent analytical, logical, and organizational skills

What's in it for you?

  • The opportunity to join a forward-thinking and collaborative team, surrounded by innovative thinkers.
  • A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional development
  • Internal training to support your growth and enhance your skills.
  • An inclusive working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
  • Work in an Ecosystem; a bright, modern space where you’ll have access to group seating, offices, collaboration spaces, a cafeteria with different options daily, a bistro, and more.
  • Hybrid Work Environment

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
