title: Anomaly Detection Workshop - Instructor
description:
Please note this position will not be formally contracted until the enrollment is finalized and the program is confirmed as running. Confirmation is expected on or before August 8, 2023. The decision on whether to proceed with the program is dependent on the number of participant registrations (i.e., a minimum number of participants must be registered).

We are advertising for these positions in advance of August 8, 2023, so we are able to move quickly on staffing and developing the program content once confirmed. Any work done prior to the program confirmation will be remunerated accordingly, even if the program is cancelled.

Please note that the Vector Institute will conduct an evaluation of workshop participants to both evaluate the performance of the instructors, as well as consider program improvements for future iterations.

The instructor(s) for this program may be asked to provide their service to other programs of similar type, where offered by the Vector Institute in the same fiscal year, provided they receive positive feedback from the program participants and receive successful evaluation from Vector’s Technical Education Specialists (TES).

STATEMENT OF WORK: Accelerated Workshop: Anomaly Detection - Instructor

This Instructor position is for the development and delivery of a 3-day accelerated Anomaly Detection workshop This workshop will be offered prior to the Anomaly Detection bootcamp organized by Vector’s Projects team to refresh and upskill novice bootcamp participants.

Program Dates: August 15, 17, 21, 2023; 1pm – 3pm EST

Location: This 3-day workshop will be delivered online via Zoom

Instructor activities include:

Administration

  • Prepare lecture content and slides in partnership with the PD, Projects and AI Engineering teams
  • Ensure that all course materials (e.g. lesson objectives, slides, discussion prompts, assignment activities) are prepared in advance of the lecture time and are available in the Vector Learning Management System (LMS), currently D2L
  • Attend scheduled program team meetings: planning and debrief (typically weekly)
  • Supervise TAs on preparation of tutorial content
  • Deliver three 2-hour lectures on the topic “Anomaly Detection”
  • Teach all lectures in the program on time, to a high standard of service, and in an environment free of distractions.
  • Respond to questions from participants as required

Teaching and evaluations

Fees: This is a paid position. The flat fee for this workshop is $3,000 (CAD) in total for development, delivery, and administration. An invoice must be submitted at the end of the workshop. All fees are payable at the end of the workshop, and upon completion of all contractual responsibilities.

Workshop Structure

Prior to the commencement of the workshop, touchpoints include:

  • Team kick-off/ curriculum development meeting
  • Team progress meeting

These meetings will accommodate schedules as much as possible.

Lessons

  • Lectures: August 15, 17, 21, 2023 (Tuesday, Thursday, Monday), 1:00 pm – 3:00 pm EST
  • TA Office Hours: Days to be confirmed, 7 pm – 8 pm EST (TBC)

The time of TA office hours will be determined by the availability of the TAs but shall be consistent throughout the workshop. The 7pm – 8pm time slot is preferred to accommodate work/life/professional development balance for the participants and provide timely support to complete their assignments.

Workshop Content

Please note: This is a projected high-level overview. The topics and content will be finalized once an instructor has been hired.

Day 1: Introduction to Anomaly Detection

I. Introduction (30 mins)

II. Anomaly Detection in Tabular Data (45 mins)

III. Anomaly Detection in Computer Vision (45 mins)

Day 2: Deep Dive into Anomaly Detection Methods

I. Advanced Anomaly Detection in Tabular Data (40 mins)

II. Advanced Anomaly Detection in Computer Vision (40 mins)

III. Introduction to Anomaly Detection in Graph Data (40 mins)

Day 3: Advanced Techniques and Real-world Applications

I. Advanced Anomaly Detection in Graph Data (40 mins)

II. Anomaly Detection in Financial Data (40 mins)

III. Conclusion and Future Directions (40 mins)

Pedagogical Approach

Workshop sessions will be delivered in an interactive lecture/discussion format, with practical examples and case studies used to spark reflection and discussion. All sessions will be delivered online via Zoom.

Level of Training and Learner Prerequisites

Pre-requisites: Basic knowledge of Python and Machine Learning. Familiarity with PyTorch or TensorFlow would be beneficial but is not mandatory. Basic understanding of Graph Theory is helpful but not necessary. Throughout the course, participants will be given code snippets and datasets to practice the discussed concepts. By the end of the workshop, participants should have a clear understanding of how to detect anomalies in tabular data, image data, and graph data, and how to apply these techniques in real-world situations.

Application

To apply, please submit your CV and cover letter to learn@vectorinstitute.ai.

Interested parties are strongly encouraged to apply as soon as possible. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until filled.

title: GRM, Risk Analyst Intern
description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

GRM, Risk Analyst Intern

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Market Risk group provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling and communicating on the nature and extent of all material market and trading credit risks and to ensure the implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures. The incumbent will lead in developing and promoting a “Best in Class” risk oversight environment for the market risk associated with RBC’s Commodities Trading business and activities

What will you do?

  • Oversee and enhance risk control processes for Local market risk: Develop key sensitivity metrics, implement metrics and establish risk reporting; establish and implement appropriate limits to ensure that business is operating within approved policies and limits; identify supplementary risk controls that may be required to manage the risks and exposure as necessary
  • Monitor trading activities and exposures to ensure they are within approved policies and limits, and that reports are timely and accurate.
  • Provide insights and commentary on key risks and exposures versus market trends and potential events.
  • Work on a particular project to improve the market risk framework.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • A Master’s degree in Finance, Economics or a Quantitative subject
  • Knowledge of market risk concepts (sensitivity analysis, VaR, stress testing etc.)
  • Knowledge of financial products: Forwards, Swaps, Options.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to condense complex details into narratives suitable for communication with senior risk and business management
  • Sufficiency in Excel-VBA, and other programming languages like Python and/or SQL.

Nice-to-have

  • Proven experience with Python and SQL.
  • Knowledge of commodity markets (Oil, Natural Gas, Precious and Base Metals, etc).

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships
  • Opportunity to learn variety of asset classes within RBC business units
  • Opportunity to learn and lead comprehensive and amalgamated ’commodities businesses and strategies’ within Market Risk
  • Potential to utilize transferable skills and grow within other related business areas

Please note: This posting is for a 4-months Winter 2024 Student placement with a start date of January 2024, and end date of April 2024. In order to be eligible for this 4-months Student position, you must either:

  • Be returning back to school after the work term end-date of April 2024 ; or
  • If you are not returning back to school (i.e. are graduating in April 2024), you must require the full 4-months work term as a mandatory component to in order to graduate successfully.

Please ensure that you meet these eligibility requirements before applying - candidates who apply but are found to be ineligible are not able to be considered.

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is October 6, 2023. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review.

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. The successful candidate for this role will be required to be located within Ontario for the duration of the work term. Details regarding the specific virtual, hybrid, and in-office arrangements for this Integrated Learning/ Co-op position are to be discussed with the Hiring Manager.

Job Summary

Implements market risk analysis and participates in implementing risk management systems and processes to minimize market risk. Applies complete knowledge, skills, and practices to perform assignments.

title: Data Analyst, Investment Finance
description:
The Data Analyst will be part of the Toronto based Financial Systems & Workflows Team within the Investment Finance Division, reporting to the Manager, Financial Systems & Workflow. The DataAanalyst will support the development of the portfolio analytics capabilities and support BI solutions for the Investment Finance team and its stakeholders to make informed decisions. The Data Analyst will work with various datasets, employ various data analysis techniques, and communicate their findings to stakeholders. To succeed in this role, the ideal individual needs a strong attention to detail and be a team player with a proven ability to build relationships between the business groups. A keen desire to explore new technologies and implement innovative solutions will enhance the success of the role.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Design and develop comprehensive dashboards and reporting leveraging Power BI or similar business intelligence tools
  • Work across functional areas to understand and identify reporting objectives to develop relevant reporting capabilities
  • Collect, cleanse, and process data sets from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets and external sources to ensure accuracy and consistency
  • Identify, analyze, interpret and report on trends or patterns in data sets
  • Review extracts, reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems, including data quality, data integrity issues, and follow the divisional data governance policies
  • Explore data sets and draw meaningful conclusions and insights, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs
  • Evaluate, analyze, and recommend potential solutions that enhance analytics and reporting
  • Conduct gap analysis to identify and recommend process improvements that affect data quality
  • Investigate, evaluate and/or propose solutions to identified problems
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, accounting, and IT, to address data-related challenges

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ years of experience in financial management and investment support environment with exposure to relevant applications and workflow activities
  • University degree in Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related discipline
  • Experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, or data visualization libraries
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages, such as Alteryx, SQL Python or others
  • Strong communication skills (written and verbal) to effectively convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience in defining, implementing, and supporting innovative business solutions
  • Familiarity with database systems and data storage technologies
  • Experience with machine learning and predictive modeling is an asset
  • Ability to maintain an innovative mindset focused on delivering business value in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

#LI-Hybrid

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $127.4 billion in net assets as at June 30, 2023. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with more than 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

title: Head, Business Intelligence & Insights
description:
Application Deadline:

10/09/2023

Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

As Head, Business Intelligence & Insights, you will play a crucial role in shaping our strategic direction by leveraging data to help senior leadership make informed decisions, manage risks, and drive innovation. You will lead a high-performing team and implement business intelligence initiatives that will help BMO Global Asset Management (GAM) deliver an optimal client experience, grow revenue, and drive efficiency. This role requires a leader who is strategic minded, has exceptional technical skills, and has a proven track record of success in building advanced analytics teams and capabilities.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Leadership & Strategy

  • Develop and execute the vision and roadmap for Business Intelligence & Insights capabilities to support BMO GAM growth strategy
  • Collaborate with senior leadership to identify opportunities for data-driven growth and efficiency improvements

Team management

  • Lead and mentor a team of analysts, data scientists, and business intelligence professionals
  • Foster a culture of continuous improvement, innovation, and learning

Insights & Analysis

  • Leverage advanced analytics capabilities (predictive, prescriptive, and machine learning) to uncover patterns, trends, and insights that may not be apparent through traditional descriptive or diagnostic analytics. Leverage these capabilities to help forecast market trends, customer demands, and emerging technologies
  • Drive innovation and competitive advantage by uncovering insights from data to identify new market opportunities, innovative product ideas, or process improvements

Reporting & Visualization

  • Research and apply continuous improvement in data visualization by identifying trends and patterns to transform raw data into actionable business insights
  • Establish reporting dashboards using visualization techniques that help users quickly identify key trends and business metrics that are actionable and relevant to them
  • Develop tools and training programs for “self-serve analytics”; may include delivery of training to audiences

Data Governance

  • Document data flow, systems, and processes to improve the design, implementation, and management of business/group processes

Technology & Tools

  • Evaluate and implement digital tools that enhance data insight capabilities
  • Stay up to date with the latest BI and analytics technologies and tools

Stakeholder Collaboration

  • Partner with Marketing, Digital, and Distribution teams to create personalized client experiences by leveraging data to understand individual preferences, behaviors, and needs. Uncover insights that will allow us to create personalized product recommendations, tailored marketing messages, and customized digital experiences
  • Foster strong internal and external networks and work with and across multiple teams to achieve business objectives
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions
  • Present insights and recommendations to senior leadership and other key stakeholders

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Proven experience building & leading a Data Science function
  • Strong understanding of the Asset Management business would be an asset
  • Typically, 9+ years of direct experience in this field or 15+ years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree (MMA, PhD, Master’s Engineering or Computer Science) or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Seasoned expert with extensive industry knowledge
  • Technical leader viewed as a thought leader for innovation
  • Expert level of proficiency in all aspects of advanced data & analytics tools and capabilities

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Manager, Digital Analytics - Tangerine
description:
Requisition ID: 185783

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:

Join the fast based team environment at Scotiabank as a Manager, Digital Analytics. The incumbent is a tagging, data analytics and insight specialist supporting digital marketing and banking initiatives across multiple channels and platforms to help drive engagement, leads, sales and loyalty.

The successful candidate will create and tell comprehensive stories about how users behave using data. You’ll deliver analytics projects of moderate complexity, partnering with other analysts and cross-functional teams along the way. Through ongoing analysis, you will gain actionable insights that better address the business goals of our internal stakeholders.

Candidate Value Proposition
• The successful candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate with analytics, marketing and digital banking squads to help optimize the efficiency and effectiveness of digital marketing campaigns, digital banking experience, and product strategy.

Job Responsibilities:

• Develop Looker Studio dashboard in scrum setting to iteratively translate business requirement in visualization and insights
• Work with senior stakeholder to perform on-demand product/digital analytics request
• Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, analysis, and algorithms used and developed
• Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real world data-driven changes
• Analyze and interpret clickstream data, providing insights to inform digital banking experience optimization and campaign strategies.
• Work with technical analytics resources to ensure tracking code is consistently applied and managed
• Be flexible and thrive in an evolving environment
• Adapt to change quickly and adjust work accordingly in a positive manner

Key Accountabilities:

• Proactively initiate, research, and perform data analysis and provide ad hoc reports to internal stakeholders on web usage, user engagement, and behavioral analytics on websites and email campaigns
• Identify patterns and trends in marketing results and online activity and report on findings
• Analyze digital marketing data and user behavior patterns to provide valuable insight and to optimize user engagement and improve the effectiveness of marketing campaigns
• Monitor site and campaign traffic and determine cross-promotion, cross-sell and lead-gen opportunities
• Assist in the development and documentation of best practices for improving operational efficiencies within the digital analytics team
• Familiarity with tag audit tools like ObservePoint and Tag Inspector
• Identify bugs and erroneous analytics tags and provide solutions to development team
• Work with Digital Channels to advise on our continually evolving digital strategy
• Ability to provide clear and concise technical direction, expertise, advice and tracking solutions to frontend developers, backend developers, and analytic teams to build tools for measurement of client platforms

Skills and Experience:
• 3+ years of proven working experience as a Digital Analyst, Digital Marketing Analyst, or similar role
• 3+ years of experience with data segmentation and reporting within Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics as well as experience with Google Tag Manager including setting up and configuring accounts for new websites and goals
• Working knowledge of GA4
• Proficient in building dashboards leveraging and blending data from multiple data sources, as well as extracting data from data environments such as BigQuery
• 2+ years of working experience with SQL and relational databases technologies/concepts for both
• Experience with Looker Studio and/or Power BI

Nice-To-Have Skills:
• Expertise in Google Analytics implementation using Google Tag Manager
• 2+ years of experience programming in Python or Spark
• 2+ years of experience with statistical analysis, machine learning and digital analytics (e.g., hypothesis driven analysis, and fraud/anomaly detection)
• Experience working with digital advertising platforms (Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, DoubleClick Manager, AppNexus) and search engine optimization is an asset

Degrees or Certifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in in STEM, or relevant field

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: AVP, Data Science and Analytics
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Sun Life Health is a leading Health and Benefits providers in Canada, offering Canadians comprehensive group benefits and a portfolio of digital health products. We are a passionate group who like to take on big challenges in a supportive environment, grounded in our purpose of helping Canadians achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives. We have an opportunity to use data to empower Canadians to take control of their health by personalizing health journeys, predicting health outcomes and preventing disease progression, and generating insights and research in partnership with the Canadian health ecosystem.

Reporting to the Vice President Strategy, Partnerships, and Analytics, the AVP Data Science & Analytics will be responsible for developing and executing our data analytics strategy to enable Sun Life Health in achieving sustainable competitive advantage and growth, and improving the health outcomes of our clients. The successful candidate will work in a fast-paced, dynamic, and fun environment with a focus on further maturing our data and data science capabilities, and developing and implementing our analytics strategy and initiatives.


What will you do:

  • Data Science and Analytics strategy development and execution
    • Develop and maintain analytics strategy that drives growth for Sun Life Health and improvements in Client health outcomes
    • Evaluate and prioritize across opportunities to predict and prevent health outcomes, personalize the client health experience, generate value-adding research, and commercializing insights
    • Partner with Sun Life Canada’s Client Experience Office to align with overall Canada data and analytics strategy
    • Execute the analytics strategy, collaborating within Sun Life health and across functional groups as needed
  • Data foundation transformation
    • Mature data foundations to support data science and analytics strategy, including further enabling personalization of Sun Life Health products
    • Collaborate with Enterprise Data & Analytics, Data Architecture, and Technology teams to design and implement necessary data architecture and engineering
  • Data science and advanced analytics
    • Apply relevant data science and analytics methodologies (including AI & ML) to deliver on our strategy
    • Lead execution of use cases and manage delivery both within the Data Science and Analytics teams, and collaborating with other Sun Life Canada businesses and functions as needed
    • Operationalize analytical models in the field by addressing technology, process and change management requirements
    • Collaborate with data analytics partners in Canada and Technology to leverage common capabilities, tools and assets
  • Thought leadership and health research
    • Develop relevant and value-adding health insights and research for internal and external audiences
    • Develop and maintain relevant relationships within the Canadian health ecosystem and academic communities, and represent Sun Life Health as a thought leader
    • Proactively foster relationships within Sun Life with business and functional partners to maintain an understanding of new developments in their areas
  • Business Intelligence
    • Coordinate development and delivery of timely and insightful reporting for Sun Life Health products (including Lumino Health Pharmacy and Lumino Provider Search)
    • Provide day-to-day data and analytics support for Sun Life Health products
    • Support product and strategy development with ad hoc business and strategic insights
  • Compliance and knowledge management
    • Implement consistent and comprehensive standards in documentation across data engineering, business intelligence and analytical models
    • Maintain documentation of existing data processes and models
    • Ensure knowledge is cross pollinated across the team to minimize key personnel knowledge risk
    • Maintain understanding of relevant regulatory frameworks and privacy policies, and ensure compliance within data management and analytical processes
  • Talent development and capability building
    • Lead and coach a diverse reporting team through proactive career development and continuous feedback
    • Actively promote Sun Life brand and community image to attract talent
    • Continue to build and mature capabilities to deliver on Data Science and Analytics strategy
    • Ensure ongoing compliance with all applicable regulatory and policy requirements

What do you need to succeed:

  • Minimum of 10 years relevant business, data, and/or analytics experience, ideally within the health, pharmacy, disease management, or benefits industries
  • Experience leading data science and analytics functions to deliver value in a business context
  • Strong technical understanding of relevant data science and analytics concepts (e.g., predictive analytics, machine learning, AI), business intelligence, and relevant technology and tools
  • Experience in leading high performing teams and professional knowledge workers
  • Experience working with health, pharmacy, or benefits data an asset
  • University degree in business, engineering, computer science or related discipline

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Manager, Quantitative Analysis
description:
Application Deadline:

11/06/2023

Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

The Quantitative Analysis and Strategy (QAS) team works closely with Corporate Treasury internal Structured Market Risk, Liquidity & Funding, and Portfolio Management partners and Lines of Business partners across the bank in identifying and quantifying risks and opportunities through analytical support and statistical model development. The analysis and modeling work cover areas of mortgage, home equity, C&I and CRE loans, consumer & commercial deposits, various securities including MBS, ABS, Muni bonds, etc.

The Manager of QAS team in Corporate Treasury will be responsible for developing, enhancing, implementing and maintaining quantitative models and analytics suites using conventional econometric and machine learning techniques for the purposes of asset liability and interest rate risk management, customer analytics and profitability, and stress testing under various macro-economic scenarios. This involves analyzing large account-level and transaction-level data, articulating the problem statement, and specifying the most appropriate quantitative solution.

Job Description

  • Understand large, complex historical data and apply data treatment process using SAS, SQL, Python, R etc.
  • Use Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence techniques to analyze loans and deposits accounts and customer-level data to specify models or quantitative assumptions that can help Line of Business and Treasury to better understand interest rate risk and customer behavior. Ensure that specification makes business sense.
  • Write detailed documentation of the developed methodologies, including data construction, methodology specification, results, and testing.
  • Put together PowerPoint presentations to present the developed methodologies to Line of Business and Corporate Treasury management to explain complex statistical techniques in simple business language.
  • Communicate with model validation to ensure successful validation of the developed methodologies.
  • Monitors and tracks developed and future model performance, and address any potential issues
  • Construct dashboard presentation to assist business decision making and identify model performance issues in a more efficient way
  • Help with routine processes such as stress testing model runs and annual model reviews.
  • Assist with ad-hoc analysis requests from Line of Business partners and other Corporate Treasury teams.

Qualifications

  • Master’s degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, Mathematical Finance) and/or combination of quantitative and business degrees required, Ph.D. preferred
  • 3+ years of strong hands-on computational development skills, particularly statistical and database modeling tools (SAS, R, SQL, Python, Hadoop, Access/VBA etc.), ability to adapt to various programming languages and environments.
  • Strong data analysis skills, and able to deal with large data sets to extract relevant information.
  • Effective presentation and communication skills; Ability to convey complex concepts and outcomes to non-subject matter experts.
  • Proficiency with statistical/econometric modeling techniques
  • Experience with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence techniques is preferred

Applies knowledge of advanced analytic algorithms and technologies (e.g. machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence) to deliver better predictions and/or intelligent automation that enables smarter business decisions, improved customer experience, and drives productivity. Applies strong communication and story-telling skills to summarize statistical/algorithmic findings, draw business conclusions, and present actionable insight in a way that resonates with business/groups. Drives innovation through the development of Data & AI products that can be leveraged across the organization and establishes best practices in in alignment with Data & AI governance frameworks of BMO.

  • Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group.
  • Influences and negotiates to achieve business objectives.
  • Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.
  • Assists in the development of strategic plans.
  • Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
  • Understands and analyzes complex business problem, then formulates data-driven hypotheses to drive business value.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
  • Supports data collection, integration, and retention requirements for data.
  • Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
  • Defines innovative data solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets.
  • Diagnoses and resolves predictive / analytical model performance issues while monitoring system performance and implementation of efficiency improvements.
  • Applies innovative and best practices to advanced analytics services to ensure high quality standards.
  • Sets up change control and testing processes to ensure the quality and consistency of ongoing maintenance work.
  • Develops analytical solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
  • Provides advice and guidance to assigned business/group on implementation of analytical solutions.
  • Works with stakeholders to identify the business requirements, understand distinct problems and expected outcomes, and models and frames business scenarios which impact critical business processes and/or decisions.
  • Works with various data owners to discover and select available data from internal sources and external vendors (e.g. lending system, payment system, external credit rating system, and alternative data) to fulfill analytical needs.
  • Applies scripting / programming skills to assemble various types of source data (unstructured, semi-structured, and structured) into well-prepared datasets with multiple levels of granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
  • Develops agreed analytical solution by applying suitable statistical & machine learning techniques (e.g., A/B testing, prototype solutions, mathematical models, algorithms, machine learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence) to test, verify, refine hypotheses.
  • Summarizes statistical findings and draws conclusions, presents actionable business recommendations. Presents findings & recommendations in a simple, clear way to drive action.
  • Documents data flow, systems and processes in data collection to improve efficiency and apply use cases.
  • Performs experimental design approaches to validate finding or test hypotheses.
  • Uses the appropriate algorithms to discover patterns.
  • Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.
  • Supports development of tools and delivers training for data analytics and AI.
  • Supports development and execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of core business/group processes.
  • Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
  • Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
  • Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
  • Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
  • Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

    Qualifications:

  • Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Advanced degree (Ph.D. preferred) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, or other quantitative disciplines and/or equivalent experience
  • Experience with distributed computing language (e.g. Hive / Hadoop/ Spark) & cloud technologies (e.g. AWS Sagemaker, AzureML).
  • Experience with programming languages (e.g. SQL, Python, R, SAS, SPSS, , Perl) and machine learning /deep learning algorithms/packages (e.g. XGBoost, H2O, SparkML).
  • Deep proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms.
  • Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
  • Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
  • Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
  • Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
  • Influence skills - In-depth.
  • Data driven decision making - In-depth.

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Senior Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst
description:
Hours

37.5

Workplace Model

Hybrid

Pay Details

We’re committed to providing fair and equitable compensation to all our colleagues. As a candidate, we encourage you to have an open dialogue with your recruiter and ask compensation related questions, including pay details for this role.

Department Overview

*Please note that we are hiring for multiple Senior Business Intelligence & Reporting Analyst (L09s) and Business Intelligence Specialist (L10s)*
What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.

This is the team building the dashboards, scorecards and business intelligent insights that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.

Joining us in Business Intelligence is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.

Job Details

  • Develop and understand business drivers, definitions, and metrics to interpret findings, take-action, and provide meaningful business direction.
  • Develop and maintain specialized Business Intelligence (BI) packages, dashboards and scorecards on the MS Azure Cloud Platform
  • Manage the repository of all reporting assets including and not limited to data analysis, development scripts, objects and documentation.
  • Maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and ability to effectively utilize these data sources
  • Lead the discussion with business partners to understand business objectives and develop valuable reporting for enablement and fact based decisioning
  • Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in all artifacts
  • Develop substantial and insightful commentary/insights on new and existing BI packages
  • Work independently as the senior analyst / expert and may provide technical support to others
  • Lead the implementation of initiatives in support of overall business/function strategy
  • Provide (and may develop) complex reporting, analysis, and assessments at the functional or enterprise level
  • Ideally have or acquire knowledge of broader enterprise reporting platforms and data sources and ability to integrate data across the enterprise

Job Requirements

  • Experience in business or financial reporting/business insights and analysis development, is knowledgeable and savvy with new technology and tools preferably within the global financial services and back-office operations
  • Hands-on experience in using business intelligence, analytics and/or data visualization tools (ex: Tableau)
  • Experience with Python, Databricks and SQL
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure is desired
  • Strong team player who fosters and thrives in an environment of peer development and sharing
  • Strong analytically-anchored problem-solving skills – a logical and strategic thinker with strong critical reasoning skills, proactively identifies risks and issues, recommends solutions, challenges the status quo
  • Enthusiastic and focused self-starter who can work with minimal supervision to strict deadlines and is able to prioritize, multitask, and manage various projects simultaneously
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to work with various level of management and senior management to convey findings concisely through presentations and business commentaries
  • Strong ownership mentality, proactive attitude, and ability to get things done
  • Demonstrated passionate analytical thinker with track record of delivering business impact and results through developing and executing on innovative BI solutions
  • Strong problem-solving skills, with a history of using data to understand not only what is happening, but why it is happening, and what can be done to resolve the issue
  • Strong organizational skills, with the ability to excel in a fast-paced environment and run multiple deadlines and priorities
  • Capable of working in and across teams, leading partners and aligning leadership – including proven teamwork and ability to build deep relationships with diverse business partners
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to proactively influence and support product decisions through analytical counsel
  • Ability to manage and supervise a team of BI analysts to provide strategic direction.

Educational Requirements/Accreditations:

  • Undergraduate degree or above preferably in an analytically based discipline
  • 3-5 years of relevant experience

Company Overview

Our Values
At TD we’re guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes … because when colleagues feel their best, they’re more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world’s leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Inclusiveness

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We’re Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Sr Data Engineer
description:

11/12/2023

Data Analytics & Reporting

Power Business Intelligence (BI) experience and a good understanding of BI architecture. Use best practice standards and methods in data modelling, data architecture, data platforms and agile delivery
Work independently as a senior lead and direct activities related to analysis, design and support of technical data management solutions on various projects ranging in complexity and size

Experience with AWS solutions - Azure data platform, experience with Azure functions and services

ITSM + Asset/CMDB knowledge is an asset

Certifications(atleast 1):

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. title: Velocity - Data Analyst Internship/Co-Op - Summer 2024
description:
Requisition ID: 189992

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: May 2024 - August 2024
Application Deadline: January 26th, 2024

Ready to Start your Journey with Scotiabank? Apply Now!

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are eager to learn about you, your interests, and your potential.

Please follow the steps below to successfully apply:

Step 1: Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.

Step 2: Complete a short one-way video interview here.

Step 3: Complete a coding test through Codility to showcase your technical skills by solving job-related problems. Please make sure to have this Codility test completed prior to applying through our career site. When you're ready, click here to begin the assessment.

Step 4: Once you have completed your Plum Profile, one-way video interview and Codility test, apply to the role on our website. Reminder: when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile!

Note: The one-way video interview & codility assessment for all our Velocity Technology Winter 2024 Internship applications are the same. You only need to complete this one!

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

The Velocity Program is not your average internship or co-op! This is a customized experience that focuses on providing you with the development and tools you need to grow your career. After successfully completing a co-op or internship with top performance, we will work with you to establish your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Be involved in the definition of business requirements and processes, ensuring that progress can be measured against planned objectives by working with different teams, and internal partners; performing analysis and completing reports to measure project success and impact to business

  • Prepare reports and dashboards to inform strategic decision-making including trending analysis, projections and forecasts utilizing statistical modelling

  • Investigate and become an expert in available data sources of data, transform and determine how they can be interpreted for analysis

  • Flex your analytical skills by identifying and analyzing business and technical requirements to create diagrams, flow charts, and documentation

  • Make impact by constantly identifying and implementing process improvements

  • Experiment & learn!

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.

  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.

  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and hackathons.

  • You have strong written/verbal communication and project management skills.

  • You have knowledge/experience in:

  1. Managing process and planning, facilitating teamwork, and coordinating the execution of multiple deliverables.
  2. Interpreting and consolidating large amounts of information in actionable recommendations.
  3. Using sound judgment in the creation of analysis, validation, interpretation, and presentation of findings.
  4. Cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g., Enterprise Data Warehouse, Unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, SAS, CSV)
  5. Visualization tools like PowerBI, Tableau or Olikview
  6. Data Analysis/manipulation tools for working with data (e.g., SQL, DB2, MySQL, Python, R)
  7. Making sense of data, creating reports, and communicating KPI’s to those who don’t speak technology

What’s in it for you?

  • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.

  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!

  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!

  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Manager, Model Monitoring - Retail & Small Business (TSYS Contract)
description:
Requisition ID: 193643

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The world is changing faster than ever and so are we!

“Big data”, “AI” and “machine learning” are not just buzz-words; they are part of our daily life. We have decades of data powering hundreds of models deployed across a multitude of systems that are crying out for smart talented team players who are results-oriented, have a broad understanding of best-in-class processes and relish the opportunity to help us turn our vision into reality. Are you ready to join the Winning Team not only building but actively managing the high-performing prediction and forecasting models behind automated risk-management decisions and forecasts that impact millions of customers and keep hundreds of $billions safe every single day?

Model Monitoring is all about ensuring that everything we build and deploy continues to perform as expected and if not, catching any deterioration early so it can be investigated and addressed. The right candidate for this role is NOT someone who wants to design and build a handful of models each year but rather, is someone willing to take on the challenge of understanding how hundreds of them (spanning a wide range of problem types, employing a myriad of methodologies) work and can, commensurately, design, optimize and build capabilities to monitor those models post implementation. In this space, we obsess over getting things done quickly and done right, the first time. We get excited by automation and leverage a combination of collaborative development and verification / testing in our approaches.

This role will be a key member of Scotiabank’s Retail & Small Business Forecasting team, responsible for effectively and efficiently building out model performance and stability monitoring insights & dashboards in accordance with policy and guidelines. This role will also work closely with our Data Analytics – Model Monitoring team with a focus on enhancing and optimizing our monitoring & insights for our regulatory capital models.

What Are We Looking For?

We want talented, pragmatic, analytically-oriented team players who can share best-in-class coding and optimization practices with the department to be leveraged across all programs, and who can who can prioritize projects and their own time to deliver the optimal balance of high value long-run results while remaining responsive to urgent and ever-shifting stakeholder needs.

The ideal candidate for this role will be a consummate team player who is equally comfortable wearing the following hats:

  • Senior Manager of Model Monitoring
  • Data Engineer / Automation Lead
  • Senior Data Analyst

Make an Impact:

In this role, you will lead the development of new and/or enhance model performance reporting of our Forecasting – Capital Models, impacting not just our team or our partners but the bank’s quarterly disclosure to the regulator.

You will collaborate on a regular basis with a wide range of stakeholders and internal partners including Model Owners (model developers), Data Analytics, and Technology & Data.

Is This Role Right for You?

  • You believe, first and foremost, in always doing the right thing and doing things the right way
  • You are both deeply curious and highly pragmatic
  • You understand data engineering, modeling, and data visualization concepts to strategize and execute dataset preparation, model assessments and reporting (including data extraction, transformations, application of statistical tests, and report generation)
  • You can evaluate results, derive model and business insights and communicate recommendations effectively, both verbally, visually and in writing
  • You ensure ongoing compliance with internal and regulatory monitoring requirements
  • You are willing and able to suggest and make enhancements to optimize and/or automate the model monitoring process
  • You relish ambitious but realistic goals and are committed to achieving them
  • You are comfortable initiating conversations, asking questions, and collaborating with diverse personalities
  • You are professional, motivated AND FUN. We mean it.

What Do You Need to Succeed?

General

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or an equivalent technical field
  • Experience as an analyst, data scientist or data engineer with a track record of accomplishments working on cross-functional teams
  • Able to work remotely and on-site on multiple activities simultaneously and meet deadlines

Technical

  • Strong fundamental understanding of mathematical models, forecasting and statistics
  • 5+ years of overall experience in data and analytics roles working with predictive, risk and/or forecasting models and big data
  • Highly proficient in 2+ analytical programming languages (Python, R, SAS, etc.), SQL (Teradata, Oracle, DB2, SQL Server) and multiple environments (Unix, Windows, GCP, Azure)
  • 2+ years experience with big data platforms / integration (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Avro)
  • Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams, PowerBI) power user
  • Experience with continuous Integration tools - Jenkins, BitBucket, GitHub

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Manager, Client Insights & Analytics
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What you’ll be doing

As the Senior Manager, Client Insights & Analytics, you will strive to be a thought partner and provide advice and recommendations that assist in the development and evaluation of client segment strategies from an analytics perspective. In this capacity, you will use segmentation to deliver data driven insights and reporting to key partners. You will create executive presentations that clearly and concisely communicate key analytical findings to business leaders. You will assess potential strategies and conduct cost/benefit analysis. The focus of this role will be New-to-Canada clients as they embark on establishing financial relationships in this country. Knowledge and ability to conduct research on current immigration trends (from Immigration Canada and other external sources) for permanent residents and foreign workers who are coming to Canada and connecting opportunities to client acquisition and retention strategies will be important.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How you’ll succeed

  • Data Savvy: Contributes to the ongoing development and enhancement of analytics, business case and visual analytic tools that leverage industry best practices. Recommend improvements to overall analytical approach for the team through interaction with internal stakeholders and through industry research. Comfortable with the end to end analytical process from ETL (extract, transform, load) to synthesizing and presenting insights.
  • Understand Business Needs: Understand the business context behind a analytics need and manage scope and project timelines. Communicate analytical findings clearly to a non-technical audience/user. Have excellent organization skills to effectively manage multiple projects of varying complexity under strict timelines.
  • Relationship Management: Form strong working relationships with key partners across the Bank (Enterprise Analytics, Client Experience, Digital, Delivery and Operational Effectiveness), as well as, external data vendors.

Who you are

  • You can demonstrate experience. 5+ years’ experience in the banking sector (preferred) and strong skills in applied statistics and mathematics. SAS, SQL and Tableau knowledge is required. Modeling skill would be an asset. Comfortable working with Big Data and have experience with complex queries and Tableau dashboard building. You can tell an insightful story from data and deliver executive presentation decks.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work, and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

title: Senior Data Modeler
description:
Requisition ID: 178360

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The Wealth Data team within the Global Wealth Engineering (GWE) team is key area in meeting the operational and analytical data needs of the various stake holders within Wealth Management.
The Senior Data Modeler will be joining a team that is key in providing strategic data solutions to meet our business objectives. The candidate will play a key role in designing and implementing data modeling solutions using relational, dimensional and NoSQL databases. Working closely with data architects, lead business systems analysts and data engineers they will be responsible for creating and maintaining data models for our databases that support multiple geographies

Is this role right for you?

  • Responsible for hands on creation of the conceptual, logical, and physical data models, the implementation of RDBMS, operational data store (ODS), data marts, and data lakes on target platforms (SQL and NoSQL)
  • Work with the Data team to implement data strategies, build data flows and develop conceptual data models.
  • Sole owner of the Data models for all data domains in Wealth management area and provide leadership and expertise in data modeling principles/methods including conceptual, logical & physical Data Models
  • Understand and translate business needs into data models supporting long-term solutions.
  • Communicate with Data Analysts, interfacing application teams & Business stakeholders and understand data requirements for consuming applications.
  • Optimize and update logical and physical data models to support new and existing projects.
  • Maintain conceptual, logical and physical data models along with corresponding metadata.
  • Develop best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models.
  • Recommend opportunities for reuse of data models in new environments.
  • Analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions.

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?

  • 10+ years of hands-on relational, dimensional, and/or analytic experience (using RDBMS, dimensional, NoSQL data platform technologies, and ETL and data ingestion protocols)
  • Experience with data hub, data warehouse, data lake, and enterprise big data platforms in multi-data-center contexts required
  • Expert knowledge of relational databases and data architecture computer systems, including SQL
  • Good knowledge of metadata management, data modeling, and related tools (Erwin or ER Studio or others) required
  • Ability to effectively convey ideas to business and technical teams
  • Ideally 5+ years’ experience in technical system analysis, data mapping and translating/mapping relational data models into XML and Schemas
  • Knowledge of database administration including database security, backup and recovery, and performance monitoring standards
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Java, Python, Scala etc
  • Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and toolset such Cloud Composer, Dataproc, CloudSpanner etc.
  • Knowledge of data streaming and technologies such as Kafka, Spark-streaming etc.
  • Should be a team player and work collaboratively
  • Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills
  • Previous experience in Wealth management and/or banking systems highly desirable
  • Nice to have experience in implementation of operational data store and involved in design of data models across multiple domains such as party, financial, non financial, securities, user domain etc
  • Nice to have understanding of Wealth business line and the various data domains required for building an end to end solution
  • Nice to have hands on experience in solution architecture and data architecture experience

What's in it for you?

  • Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
  • Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
  • Remote-friendly work environment will provide you with the flexibility to perform at your best.
  • Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.
  • Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
  • Dynamic Office - Fully equipped gym, showers, games room, bowling alley, micro market, free tea & coffee, universal washrooms, wellness rooms, and lots of space for team collaboration.
  • Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!

Working location condition: Hybrid

#LI-Hybrid

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.
